[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Online Shopping System (OSS) defines requirements for product browsing, cart management, order processing, secure payments, and customer engagement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: OSS enables customers to browse, purchase, track orders, and manage payments while integrating with inventory, logistics, and customer support services.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: OSS integrates with payment gateways, inventory databases, order tracking systems, and customer support platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: OSS provides a web-based and mobile UI with product filtering, recommendations, and secure checkout.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: OSS supports barcode scanners for inventory management and integrates with POS systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: OSS connects with third-party APIs for payment processing, shipping, and social media integrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: OSS ensures encrypted transactions and supports customer notifications via email and SMS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: OSS optimizes data storage for product listings, transaction history, and personalized recommendations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: OSS automates product recommendations, checkout processes, inventory updates, and customer service inquiries.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: OSS supports multiple payment options, currencies, and regional tax calculations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: OSS connects with logistics partners, financial services, and fraud prevention systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: OSS provides search, product recommendations, shopping cart management, secure checkout, and order tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: OSS serves individual customers, retailers, and vendors managing e-commerce sales.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: OSS relies on third-party payment providers and shipping carriers for successful transactions and deliveries.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: OSS depends on payment gateway APIs, shipping partners, and inventory synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with third-party payment gateways, logistics services, and product databases.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide real-time product availability and pricing updates from vendor databases (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable secure checkout, allowing multiple payment options such as credit cards, digital wallets, and bank transfers (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall enable order tracking with real-time logistics updates and support returns/exchanges per policy (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall offer an intuitive UI with product reviews, wishlists, and personalized recommendations.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall handle up to 10,000 concurrent users without performance degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store product information, order history, and payment records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with PCI DSS standards for payment security.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to GDPR for customer data protection.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication, encrypted transactions, and customer data privacy (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SEC] 3. Verification: Order processing validation, payment security checks, and compliance audits ensure system reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: PCI DSS compliance, GDPR regulations, and e-commerce security standards.
